Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2012 04:10AM mominsnj wrote: thank you all for the warm welcome.  I wasnt sure if I needed a support group of some kind or not but I definitely feel better after posting here. :)  Reesie,I looked at that conference info and it might be something I would want to go to but it will be the weekend after my next infusion.  My mom will be here however so maybe she and I can go together.  I will have to talk with my husband and see if he can handle the boys all weekend by himself. (I have 2 young ones, 3 and 5 with the 5 yr old having Autism so it is double tough sometimes) (I have 5 children altogether)
Posts.Title: trying to figure out where i fit in here mominsnj LuAnnH

Posts.Content: mominsnj wrote:  I am recenty diagnosed 11/2011 with Invasive ductal carcinoma, triple negative.  In 12/2012  was told stage 4 metastatic and that I would never be considered "cured" but many live a long time with a good quality of life.  Started chemo 1/2012 and am currently in my second "round" of cycles.  Saw my Onc this past monday and he said that I will have a PET scan after my next cycle (about 5 weeks from now).  I was surprised by this as I was originally told after my 3rd round of cycles I would get the PET scan, but I guess my cat scan showed some shrinkage of the tumors so he wants it done earlier. I dont understand what people mean when they say "mets" can anyone explain that to me? are you referencing tumors removed from the breasts?  I still dont fully undestand why I am stage 4 and metastatic.  I feel like I must be missing some information the Dr gave me already to understand.  I don't think I have been taking this as seriously as I should be, it seems very real and very removed at the same time.   I am trying to figure out what to expect from now on but as I have been searching around I dont see any stage iv metastatic triple negative BC threads.  I dont even know what info I am looking for, it is like being thrown in the deep end of the pool and not knowing how to swim.  Any help, insight or direction to the right area would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you. Jynna Dx 11/17/2011, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 5/5 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: trying to figure out where i fit in here mominsnj LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2012 02:22PM mominsnj wrote: Thank you both, your info has helped a lot!  My current chemotherapy is taxotere every 3rd monday and xeloda for 14 days starting the same day as the taxotere infusion.  Side effects, well Of course I lost all my hair (very traumatic but i bought a bunch of wigs and hats and scarves) Nausea and vomiting that is well controlled by meds most of the time, I go back and forth between constipation and diarrhea. Fatigue, neuropathy, hand/foot syndrome, a rash on my chest/neck, feeling like i am beaten all over, sleep issues. I feel week all the time and Thrush.  I was in the hospital once for neutropenia. Oh and everything tastes like crap but I'm not too hungry so that helps.  I do enjoy not having to shave very often!
Posts.Title: trying to figure out where i fit in here mominsnj LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 01:49PM mominsnj wrote: Thanks for the tip LuAnnH.  I never knew that about the ice.  But usually I fall asleep during infusion, I just pass out, Benadryl does that to me and it takes a couple days to wear off and by then I am into the side effects.  This cycle I am actually having a break from Xeloda and I am loving it, but not loving the Thrush I got again, yuck, it makes me extra sick.  I honestly dont mind the side effects too much the doctors have me on a good pain regimen that mostly works.  Sometimes it is bad and I have to use a cane but mostly I stay home so ehh, I still feel I could haNDLE  a lot more side effects before saying enough, I have to stop.  I am not quite dragging myself around on the floor yet (thank God because the house is a wreck 99% of the time) and the children are mostly good about not jumping on me, now just to finish potty training! @CoolBreeze - most of my confusion comes from trying to figure out where my "mets" are.  I have cancer in both breasts, in the lymph nodes under both arms, along the clavicle and on both sides of the trachea and in the lymph nodes of my neck, I think.  And something on the breastbone behind where my tumor was. nothing in the bones, brains or organs. so I dont really get it, it seems everything is in lymph nodes throughout my chest cavity.  They did say no more surgery which pretty much made me angry as I felt like I deserved to get new breasts after all the suffering I was going to go through.  Looked at it like a reward as I always wanted a perky job when I was sure I was done having children.  That was very hard to get past, losing my fertility and is still difficult to believe has happened/is happening.  The good thing is all the children agree to adopting a little girl when we get to that point so that helps.  I am mostly positive and have a lot of Faith that I will be around for a long time to come and I have a sense of humor about it.  Of course the little ones only know that mommy is sick.  I feel bad that my oldest daughter will have to start having mammograms at 27/28, that is only 7 or 8 years away!  so young!  I did have the BRCA 1/2 tests done and they came out negative and there is not really any history of cancer in my family so it came out of left field to be in this stage at my age. And let me just apologize for my terrible typing in advance, my hands dont quite work they way they used to, I try to fix mistakes but dont always see them.
Posts.Title: trying to figure out where i fit in here mominsnj LuAnnH
